Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Preoperative Lugol Solution in Total Thyroidectomy for Graves’ Disease

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease at Padua University Hospital, Italy

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive 7 days of Lugol treatment (Lugol+ group, 29) or no Lugol treatment (Lugol− group, 27)

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the effects of preoperative Lugol solution on thyroid vascularization and surgical morbidity

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative and postoperative blood loss, measured directly and indirectly.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using Sealed Envelope TM software, with allocation concealment ensured.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors and clinicians were blinded, but patients were not.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 56 patients undergoing total thyroidectomy for Graves’ disease at Padua University Hospital, Italy, between February 2020 and April 2023

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found between groups for intraoperative/postoperative blood loss (median 80 ml vs 94 ml)

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported, though 35 patients experienced a metallic taste, and 15 had difficulties obtaining the solution.
